summary: Comprehensive backend testing completed for HostBay Telegram platform after Railway resource optimization changes. All 13 test cases passed successfully, validating health endpoints, API structure, event-driven job processors, optimized database pool settings, and single JSON log format. The optimization changes are working correctly and the backend is fully operational.
passed_tests: Health endpoint (/api/health) returns valid JSON with status, http_server, services, summary fields
API root endpoint (/api/v1) returns valid JSON with name, version, endpoints
Backend serves developer portal HTML at root path (/)
Event-driven job queue signals module loads correctly with callable functions
Domain registration job service imports and returns valid instance with required methods
Hosting order job service imports and returns valid instance with required methods
Webhook handler imports work correctly with all expected components
APScheduler jobs correctly configured (old polling processors removed, event-driven in place)
Database module loads with optimized pool settings (min=2, max=10, 5 workers)
Production logging module loads with no-op _setup_structured_logging
Log format optimized to single JSON format (no duplicates)
Thread pool executor correctly configured with 5 workers
All module imports working without errors
